data.headline: January CPI rose 0.2% m/m and 2.4% y/y, both below forecasts, with core inflation at four-year lows, reinforcing disinflation trends
bullets: Treasury yields fell as rate-hike fears eased and odds of Fed rate cuts increased
S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq, and Russell 2000 all advanced, with the Russell 2000 up about 1.7% on strong small-cap buying
Rotation into small caps and value stocks halted the previous session’s AI-driven tech selloff
Applied Materials surged roughly 13% and Tri Pointe Homes jumped about 27% as top gainers
Rivian and Roku also posted notable gains
Tariff-exposed metals and steel stocks lagged the broader market
Major indices remain on track for weekly losses amid lingering tech sector jitters
Traders face a quiet calendar ahead of next week’s key jobs data
